intro: Seseli aroanicum, commonly known as the Aromanian seseli, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
